VI.ii.2.6.c
.
Status of a Recoupment Balance When VA Stops Paying Compensation
When VA stops paying a Veteran compensation from which it had been recouping separation benefits, any amount VA has not yet recouped
remains as a charge against any future award of compensation, and
is
subject to recoupment from any future award of compensation.
Exception
:  The principle set forth in this block does
not
apply when the Veteran dies before VA finishes recouping separation benefits.  The recoupment balance does
not
remain as a charge against survivors benefits VA subsequently pays based on the Veteran’s service.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart ii, Chapter 2 - Recoupment of Separation Benefits
